txt.en:
'You have already lent great service to our expedition, [placeholder], and I want to be certain you know what you are getting into. The history of Khazad-dûm is sad and grim, and it is Bósi's wish that all who lend their aid to our cause know what might await them inside the mines.

'I will tell you the story of the fall of Moria, if you will hear it, and give reasons why Khazad-dûm is called \qMoria\q by the Elves: \qBlack Pit.\q

'You surely know the story already, friend dwarf, but hearing it anew will make our victory all the sweeter, when at last it comes.'

'Though Náin and his kinsmen stood against the great evil that slew Durin, they did not stand long: Náin was killed by the shadow the following year and the dwarves were forced to abandon Khazad-dûm. Many of the Silvan Elves fled Lothlórien in terror of the nameless fear, flying southward and cursing the dwarves as they went.

'From time to time some brave dwarf has been known to seek those halls. Lord Balin is the most recent, but despite some encouraging reports shortly after his expedition arrived, we have not heard from him in many years, and begin to despair of finding him again.

'Bósi fears that he has perished, but it could be that Balin lives still within some deep hall. It is possible, but my thoughts are like to Bósi's. Thank you for listening to the tale, my friend. You see now how important this expedition is to my people.'

'You know as well as I do what became of Náin I, [placeholder], for all dwarves are told the sad story in childhood. Though he and his kinsmen stood against the great evil that slew Durin, they did not stand long: Náin was killed by the shadow the following year and our people were forced to abandon Khazad-dûm. Many of the Silvan Elves departed Lothlórien, fleeing southward in anger and fear, cursing the names of our people.

'From time to time some brave dwarf seeks to return to those halls. Lord Balin is the most recent, but despite some encouraging reports shortly after his expedition arrived, we have not heard from him in many years.

'Bósi fears that he has perished, but it could be that Balin lives still within some deep hall. It is possible, but as you know the story of Moria is dark and full of sadness, and I do not share the confidence of some others.

'Thank you for listening again to the tale, my friend. We must reclaim Khazad-dûm! It is our birthright as dwarves!'
Because you have provided a great deal of assistance to the dwarves of Bósi and Brogur's expedition, they want to ensure that you know the story of Moria's fall before you help them further.

'You have done us a great service already, friend, but there is something you should know about the Mines before you accompany the Iron Garrison into the mountains. Speak to me if you are willing to hear what I have to say.'

Ráthwald is by the archway near the camp of Echad Dúnann in Eregion.\n\nYou have provided much assistance to the dwarves of the expedition, and should now return to Ráthwald to hear the tale of the fall of Moria.

'You have been a tremendous help to us, [placeholder], and have aided us with so many tasks! You have enabled the exploration of both the Brackwater and Filgogân for lost friends and hidden treasure, and have valiantly withstood the threats within.

'But the halls and caverns of Khazad-dûm may harbour even greater danger, and I want you to know what you will be getting into before you follow us past the Doors of Durin.

'Return to Ráthwald who stands guard by the camp of Echad Dúnann, and have him tell you the tale of the fall of Moria. He will speak of dark times, but you should know the story before you walk into the dark, even if it makes you think ill of Khazad-dûm -- though I hope it will not be so.'
Ráthwald is by the archway near the camp of Echad Dúnann in Eregion.\n\nRáthwald has agreed to tell you the tale of the fall of Moria.
Ráthwald is by the archway near the camp of Echad Dúnann in Eregion.\n\nRáthwald has told you the tale of the fall of Moria and is waiting to speak with you.
'Listen well, [placeholder], and I will tell you the tale of the Fall of Moria.'

'You have been a tremendous help to us, [placeholder], and have aided us with so many tasks! You have helped us to explore both the Brackwater and Filgogân for lost friends and hidden treasure, and have stood tall against the threats within.

'But the halls and caverns of Khazad-dûm may hold even greater danger, and I want you to know what you will be getting into before you follow us past the Doors of Durin.

'Return to Ráthwald, on guard by the camp of Echad Dúnann, where the road passes beneath the old Elf-arch, and have him tell you the tale of the fall of Moria. They were dark times, but you should know the story, even if you have heard it before.'

'You have been a tremendous help to us, [placeholder], and have aided us with so many tasks! You have helped us to explore both the Brackwater and Filgogân for lost friends and hidden treasure, and have stood tall against the threats within.

'But the halls and caverns of Khazad-dûm may hold even greater danger, and I want you to know what you will be getting into before you follow us past the Doors of Durin.

Talk to Ráthwald

'But the halls and caverns of Khazad-dûm may hold even greater danger, and I want you to know what you will be getting into before you follow us past the Doors of Durin.

Talk to Ráthwald and listen to the tale of the fall of Moria
Talk to Ráthwald

'You have been a tremendous help to us, [placeholder], and have aided us with so many tasks! You have helped us to explore both the Brackwater and Filgogân for lost friends and hidden treasure, and have stood tall against the threats within.

'But the halls and caverns of Khazad-dûm may hold even greater danger, and I want you to know what you will be getting into before you follow us past the Doors of Durin.

'Return to Ráthwald, on guard by the camp of Echad Dúnann, where the road passes beneath the old Elf-arch, and have him tell you the tale of the fall of Moria. They were dark times, but you should know the story, even if you have heard it before.'
The Fall of Moria

'You have been a tremendous help to us, [placeholder], and have aided us with so many tasks! You have helped us to explore both the Brackwater and Filgogân for lost friends and hidden treasure, and have stood tall against the threats within.

'But the halls and caverns of Khazad-dûm may hold even greater danger, and I want you to know what you will be getting into before you follow us past the Doors of Durin.

'Return to Ráthwald, on guard by the camp of Echad Dúnann, where the road passes beneath the old Elf-arch, and have him tell you the tale of the fall of Moria. They were dark times, but you should know the story, even if you have heard it before.'

'You have already lent great service to our expedition, [placeholder], and I do not wish to be held responsible if you come to a...bad sort of end. The history of Khazad-dûm is sad and grim, and it is Bósi's wish that all who lend their aid to our cause know what might await them inside the mines.

'I will tell you the story of the fall of Moria, if you will hear it, and give reasons why Khazad-dûm is called \qMoria\q by the Elves: \qBlack Pit.\q

'Listen well, and if you still wish to follow the dwarves into Moria, we can talk it over.'
